issue.title: Set router flavor to `traditional_compatible` in konnect related manifests

labels.name: area/konnect
labels.description: Issues and PRs related to Konnect

milestone.title: KIC v3.0.0
milestone.description: This major release of the ingress controller is intended to enable several new features and allow for large (and in some cases backwards-incompatible) changes.

issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Current Behavior

The e2e tests for testing integration with Konnect fails when router flavor is set to `expressions`. Konnect may not support expression based routes.

### Expected Behavior

e2e tests pass.

### Steps To Reproduce

```markdown
Run the Konnect related e2e tests
```


### Kong Ingress Controller version

_No response_

### Kubernetes version

_No response_

### Anything else?

_No response_

pull_request.title: fix: set router flavor to traditional_compatible in konnect related manifests
pull_request.body:
<!-- Thanks for sending a pull request! Here are some tips for you:
1. If this is your first time, read our contributor guidelines https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/contributors/guide/pull-requests.md#the-pull-request-submit-process and developer guide https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/contributors/devel/development.md
2. If you want *faster* PR reviews, read how: https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/contributors/guide/pull-requests.md#best-practices-for-faster-reviews
3. Follow the instructions for writing a release note: https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/contributors/guide/release-notes.md and ensure your changes are being reflected in CHANGELOG.md for the next upcoming release
-->

**What this PR does / why we need it**:

<!-- Please describe why this particular PR is necessary or why you see it as a nice addition -->

Konnect seems not to support expression routes. We need to set router flavor to `traditional_compatible` to pass e2e tests for integration with Konnect.

**Which issue this PR fixes**:

<!--
Here you can add any links to issues that this PR is relevant for.
You can use Github keywords (like: closes, fixes or resolves) to auto-resolve
the linked issue(s) when this PR gets merged.

For example: fixes #<issue number>
-->
fixes #4993 
**Special notes for your reviewer**:

<!-- Here you can add any open questions or notes that you might have for reviewers -->

**PR Readiness Checklist**:

Complete these before marking the PR as `ready to review`:

- [ ] the `CHANGELOG.md` release notes have been updated to reflect any significant (and particularly user-facing) changes introduced by this PR

issue.title: Use `expressions` router in Konnect related manifests when it's support in Konnect

labels.name: area/konnect
labels.description: Issues and PRs related to Konnect

issue.body:
### Problem statement

#4994 reverted a change which made Konnect related manifests use the `expressions` router flavor.

This issue tracks using `expressions` router in Konnect related manifests when that's properly supports.

### Related issues

- koko failing to parse `Route`'s `priority` field due to using an `int` rather than `int64`

  ```
  2023-10-27T06:19:01.133115951Z stderr F 2023-10-27T06:19:01Z	error	Failed pushing configuration to Konnect	{"error": "performing update for https://us.kic.api.konghq.tech/kic/api/control-planes/d5f6b587-8c75-4c7d-ad9f-74e9282270c0 failed: 1 errors occurred:\n\twhile processing event: {Create} route default.echo.echo..1027 failed: HTTP status 400 (message: \"proto:\\u00a0(line 1:241): invalid value for int32 type: 3382097767104518\")\n"}
  ```

  TODO: add issue reference

comment.body:
> We will set `traditional_compatible` for Konnect in the `values.yaml` provided by the UI. We should merge this PR until the Koko fix is delivered

👍 Please note that @mheap is referring to UI instructions which use the helm chart, so this change here does fix our manifests but do not really influence the chart in any way.

Let's merge this to make sure we have passing e2e suite and let's create a follow up issue to change the default router flavor in konnect manifest to `expressions` when that's solved on koko's side.

pull_request.title: feat(gateway_discovery) enable gateway discovery in db mode
pull_request.body:
<!-- Thanks for sending a pull request! Here are some tips for you:
1. If this is your first time, read our contributor guidelines https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/contributors/guide/pull-requests.md#the-pull-request-submit-process and developer guide https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/contributors/devel/development.md
2. If you want *faster* PR reviews, read how: https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/contributors/guide/pull-requests.md#best-practices-for-faster-reviews
3. Follow the instructions for writing a release note: https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/contributors/guide/release-notes.md and ensure your changes are being reflected in CHANGELOG.md for the next upcoming release
-->

**What this PR does / why we need it**:

<!-- Please describe why this particular PR is necessary or why you see it as a nice addition -->

enables gateway discovery in DB mode. In DB mode, if multiple gateways are behind the Kong admin API service, KIC will discover all ready clients and send config to one of them in sending configurations.

**Which issue this PR fixes**:

<!--
Here you can add any links to issues that this PR is relevant for.
You can use Github keywords (like: closes, fixes or resolves) to auto-resolve
the linked issue(s) when this PR gets merged.

For example: fixes #<issue number>
-->
fixes #4751 

**Special notes for your reviewer**:

<!-- Here you can add any open questions or notes that you might have for reviewers -->

This PR could not cover the case where multiple gateways are using different DBs. This case is tracked in #4845.

**PR Readiness Checklist**:

Complete these before marking the PR as `ready to review`:

- [x] the `CHANGELOG.md` release notes have been updated to reflect any significant (and particularly user-facing) changes introduced by this PR

@@ -13,12 +13,15 @@ import (
 	"github.com/kong/kubernetes-ingress-controller/v2/internal/adminapi"
 	"github.com/kong/kubernetes-ingress-controller/v2/internal/util"
 	"github.com/kong/kubernetes-ingress-controller/v2/internal/util/clock"

 )
 
 // DefaultReadinessReconciliationInterval is the interval at which the manager will run readiness reconciliation loop.
 // It's the same as the default interval of a Kubernetes container's readiness probe.
 const DefaultReadinessReconciliationInterval = 10 * time.Second
 
+const DefaultAdminAPIServicePort = 8444
+

3. Follow the instructions for writing a release note: https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/contributors/guide/release-notes.md and ensure your changes are being reflected in CHANGELOG.md for the next upcoming release
-->

**What this PR does / why we need it**:

<!-- Please describe why this particular PR is necessary or why you see it as a nice addition -->

Konnect seems not to support expression routes. We need to set router flavor to `traditional_compatible` to pass e2e tests for integration with Konnect.

**Which issue this PR fixes**:

<!--
Here you can add any links to issues that this PR is relevant for.
You can use Github keywords (like: closes, fixes or resolves) to auto-resolve
the linked issue(s) when this PR gets merged.

For example: fixes #<issue number>
-->
fixes #4993 
**Special notes for your reviewer**:

<!-- Here you can add any open questions or notes that you might have for reviewers -->

**PR Readiness Checklist**:

Complete these before marking the PR as `ready to review`:

- [ ] the `CHANGELOG.md` release notes have been updated to reflect any significant (and particularly user-facing) changes introduced by this PR

comment.body: We will set `traditional_compatible` for Konnect in the `values.yaml` provided by the UI. We should merge this PR until the Koko fix is delivered

issue.title: fix: set router flavor to traditional_compatible in konnect related manifests

labels.name: area/konnect
labels.description: Issues and PRs related to Konnect

milestone.title: KIC v3.0.0
milestone.description: This major release of the ingress controller is intended to enable several new features and allow for large (and in some cases backwards-incompatible) changes.

issue.body:
<!-- Thanks for sending a pull request! Here are some tips for you:
1. If this is your first time, read our contributor guidelines https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/contributors/guide/pull-requests.md#the-pull-request-submit-process and developer guide https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/contributors/devel/development.md
2. If you want *faster* PR reviews, read how: https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/contributors/guide/pull-requests.md#best-practices-for-faster-reviews
3. Follow the instructions for writing a release note: https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/contributors/guide/release-notes.md and ensure your changes are being reflected in CHANGELOG.md for the next upcoming release
-->

**What this PR does / why we need it**:

<!-- Please describe why this particular PR is necessary or why you see it as a nice addition -->

Konnect seems not to support expression routes. We need to set router flavor to `traditional_compatible` to pass e2e tests for integration with Konnect.

**Which issue this PR fixes**:

<!--
Here you can add any links to issues that this PR is relevant for.
You can use Github keywords (like: closes, fixes or resolves) to auto-resolve
the linked issue(s) when this PR gets merged.

For example: fixes #<issue number>

comment.body:
> This means KIC 3.0 is blocked on the koko bug fixed and deployed to Konnect.

That sounds to me like a decision to be made by @mheap whether we want to rely on Koko fix to be delivered before the release, or do we want to document that `expressions` do not work with KIC-Konnect integration for now.
Reading https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/gateway-api/pull/2535 it appears it doesn't have to be `Accepted` so sounds right to skip it.

pull_request.title: fix: set accepted even if gateway could not be programmed and attach route to listener even if listener not ready
pull_request.body:
<!-- Thanks for sending a pull request! Here are some tips for you:
1. If this is your first time, read our contributor guidelines https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/contributors/guide/pull-requests.md#the-pull-request-submit-process and developer guide https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/contributors/devel/development.md
2. If you want *faster* PR reviews, read how: https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/contributors/guide/pull-requests.md#best-practices-for-faster-reviews
3. Follow the instructions for writing a release note: https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/contributors/guide/release-notes.md and ensure your changes are being reflected in CHANGELOG.md for the next upcoming release
-->

**What this PR does / why we need it**:

<!-- Please describe why this particular PR is necessary or why you see it as a nice addition -->

To pass the conformance test `GatewayWithAttachedRoutes`, the PR:
- Set `Accepted` of listener to true even if the listener could not be `Programmed`
- Attach routes to listeners even if the listener is not ready

**Which issue this PR fixes**:

<!--
Here you can add any links to issues that this PR is relevant for.
You can use Github keywords (like: closes, fixes or resolves) to auto-resolve
the linked issue(s) when this PR gets merged.

comment.body: Ah, the `accepted` in the test case name is about the expected test result. Nevermind. Maybe I'd only suggest rephrasing to `route accepted when listener not programmed`.
